intro: Laphamia gilensis var. gilensis, commonly known as the Gil's laphamia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant collectors.
